controllers.smc.algorithms.adaptive.parameter_estimationÂ¶

Source: src\controllers\smc\algorithms\adaptive\parameter_estimation.py

Module OverviewÂ¶

Parameter and Uncertainty Estimation for Adaptive SMC.

Implements online estimation of system uncertainties and disturbance bounds to improve adaptive gain selection and overall controller performance.

Mathematical Background:

  • Uncertainty bound estimation: Î·Ì‚ = max{|disturbance|, model_error}

  • Sliding mode observer: estimate unknown dynamics components

  • Recursive least squares: parameter identification

Advanced Mathematical TheoryÂ¶

Uncertainty ParametrizationÂ¶

Model uncertainty:

\[\Delta(\vec{x}, t) = \vec{\phi}^T(\vec{x}) \vec{\theta} + \epsilon(t)\]

Where:

  • \(\vec{\phi}\): Known regressor (basis functions)

  • \(\vec{\theta}\): Unknown parameter vector

  • \(\epsilon\): Bounded residual (\(|\epsilon| \leq \epsilon_{max}\))

Recursive Least Squares (RLS)Â¶

Update law:

\[\begin{split}\begin{align} \hat{\vec{\theta}}(k+1) &= \hat{\vec{\theta}}(k) + \mathbf{P}(k) \vec{\phi}(k) [y(k) - \vec{\phi}^T(k) \hat{\vec{\theta}}(k)] \\ \mathbf{P}(k+1) &= \mathbf{P}(k) - \frac{\mathbf{P}(k) \vec{\phi}(k) \vec{\phi}^T(k) \mathbf{P}(k)}{1 + \vec{\phi}^T(k) \mathbf{P}(k) \vec{\phi}(k)} \end{align}\end{split}\]

Persistent ExcitationÂ¶

For parameter convergence, regressor must be persistently exciting:

\[\alpha_1 \mathbf{I} \leq \int_t^{t+T} \vec{\phi}(\tau) \vec{\phi}^T(\tau) d\tau \leq \alpha_2 \mathbf{I}\]

For all \(t \geq 0\) and some \(T > 0\), \(\alpha_2 > \alpha_1 > 0\).

Gradient EstimationÂ¶

Steepest descent:

\[\dot{\hat{\vec{\theta}}} = -\Gamma \vec{\phi}(\vec{x}) e\]

Where \(e = y - \vec{\phi}^T \hat{\vec{\theta}}\) is prediction error.

Lyapunov-Based EstimationÂ¶

Candidate function:

\[V = \frac{1}{2} e^2 + \frac{1}{2} \tilde{\vec{\theta}}^T \Gamma^{-1} \tilde{\vec{\theta}}\]

Derivative:

\[\dot{V} = e \dot{e} + \tilde{\vec{\theta}}^T \Gamma^{-1} \dot{\tilde{\vec{\theta}}}\]

Choosing \(\dot{\hat{\vec{\theta}}} = \Gamma \vec{\phi} e\) yields \(\dot{V} \leq 0\).

Projection AlgorithmÂ¶

Constrained estimation:

\[\dot{\hat{\vec{\theta}}} = \text{Proj}(\hat{\vec{\theta}}, \Gamma \vec{\phi} e)\]

Ensures \(\hat{\vec{\theta}} \in \Theta\) (admissible parameter set).

Architecture DiagramÂ¶

graph TD A[Measurement y] --> B[Prediction Error: e = y - Ï†áµ€Î¸Ì‚] B --> C[Gradient: âˆ‡Î¸ = Î“Ï†e] C --> D[Update: Î¸Ì‚_k+1_ = Î¸Ì‚_k_ + Î“Ï†e] D --> E{Projection} E -->|In bounds| F[Î¸Ì‚ âˆˆ Î˜] E -->|Out bounds| G[Project to Î˜] G --> F F --> H[Estimated Parameters Î¸Ì‚] style B fill:#ff9 style H fill:#9f9

Usage ExamplesÂ¶

Example 1: Basic InitializationÂ¶

from src.controllers.smc.algorithms.adaptive import *

# Initialize with configuration
config = {'parameter': 'value'}
instance = Component(config)

Example 2: Performance TuningÂ¶

# Adjust parameters for better performance
optimized_params = tune_parameters(instance, target_performance)

Example 3: Integration with ControllerÂ¶

# Use in complete control loop
controller = create_controller(ctrl_type, config)
result = simulate(controller, duration=5.0)

Example 4: Edge Case HandlingÂ¶

try:
    output = instance.compute(state)
except ValueError as e:
    handle_edge_case(e)

Example 5: Performance AnalysisÂ¶

# Analyze metrics
metrics = compute_metrics(result)
print(f"ITAE: {metrics.itae:.3f}")

Complete Source CodeÂ¶

  1#======================================================================================\\\
  2#========== src/controllers/smc/algorithms/adaptive/parameter_estimation.py ===========\\\
  3#======================================================================================\\\
  4
  5"""
  6Parameter and Uncertainty Estimation for Adaptive SMC.
  7
  8Implements online estimation of system uncertainties and disturbance bounds
  9to improve adaptive gain selection and overall controller performance.
 10
 11Mathematical Background:
 12- Uncertainty bound estimation: Î·Ì‚ = max{|disturbance|, model_error}
 13- Sliding mode observer: estimate unknown dynamics components
 14- Recursive least squares: parameter identification
 15"""
 16
 17import numpy as np
 18from collections import deque
 19
 20
 21class UncertaintyEstimator:
 22    """
 23    Online uncertainty estimation for adaptive SMC.
 24
 25    Estimates bounds on system uncertainties and disturbances
 26    to improve adaptive gain selection.
 27    """
 28
 29    def __init__(self,
 30                 window_size: int = 50,
 31                 forgetting_factor: float = 0.95,
 32                 initial_estimate: float = 1.0,
 33                 estimation_gain: float = 0.1):
 34        """
 35        Initialize uncertainty estimator.
 36
 37        Args:
 38            window_size: Size of sliding window for estimation
 39            forgetting_factor: Î» âˆˆ (0,1] for exponential forgetting
 40            initial_estimate: Initial uncertainty bound estimate
 41            estimation_gain: Learning rate for uncertainty adaptation
 42        """
 43        if not (0 < forgetting_factor <= 1):
 44            raise ValueError("Forgetting factor must be in (0, 1]")
 45        if window_size <= 0:
 46            raise ValueError("Window size must be positive")
 47        if initial_estimate <= 0:
 48            raise ValueError("Initial estimate must be positive")
 49        if estimation_gain <= 0:
 50            raise ValueError("Estimation gain must be positive")
 51
 52        self.window_size = window_size
 53        self.lambda_forget = forgetting_factor
 54        self.eta_hat = initial_estimate
 55        self.alpha = estimation_gain
 56
 57        # History buffers
 58        self._surface_history = deque(maxlen=window_size)
 59        self._control_history = deque(maxlen=window_size)
 60        self._surface_derivative_history = deque(maxlen=window_size)
 61        self._uncertainty_estimates = deque(maxlen=window_size)
 62
 63    def update_estimate(self, surface_value: float, surface_derivative: float,
 64                       control_input: float, dt: float) -> float:
 65        """
 66        Update uncertainty estimate based on sliding surface behavior.
 67
 68        Args:
 69            surface_value: Current sliding surface s
 70            surface_derivative: Surface derivative á¹¡
 71            control_input: Applied control u
 72            dt: Time step
 73
 74        Returns:
 75            Updated uncertainty bound estimate Î·Ì‚
 76        """
 77        # Store history
 78        self._surface_history.append(surface_value)
 79        self._surface_derivative_history.append(surface_derivative)
 80        self._control_history.append(control_input)
 81
 82        # Estimate uncertainty from sliding surface behavior
 83        uncertainty_indicator = self._compute_uncertainty_indicator(
 84            surface_value, surface_derivative, control_input
 85        )
 86
 87        # Update estimate with forgetting factor
 88        self.eta_hat = (self.lambda_forget * self.eta_hat +
 89                       self.alpha * uncertainty_indicator)
 90
 91        # Store estimate
 92        self._uncertainty_estimates.append(self.eta_hat)
 93
 94        return self.eta_hat
 95
 96    def _compute_uncertainty_indicator(self, s: float, s_dot: float, u: float) -> float:
 97        """
 98        Compute uncertainty indicator from surface behavior.
 99
100        High uncertainty is indicated by:
101        - Large |á¹¡| despite control effort
102        - Persistent surface magnitude |s|
103        - High control effort with poor surface reduction
104        """
105        # Method 1: Surface derivative magnitude (indicates reaching law violation)
106        reaching_violation = abs(s_dot) + abs(s)  # Should be negative for reaching
107
108        # Method 2: Control effectiveness (high u with large |s| indicates uncertainty)
109        if abs(u) > 1e-6:
110            control_effectiveness = abs(s) / (abs(u) + 1e-6)
111        else:
112            control_effectiveness = abs(s)
113
114        # Method 3: Sliding condition violation
115        sliding_condition = s * s_dot  # Should be negative for sliding
116
117        # Combine indicators
118        uncertainty_indicator = (0.4 * reaching_violation +
119                               0.4 * control_effectiveness +
120                               0.2 * max(0, sliding_condition))
121
122        return uncertainty_indicator
123
124    def get_uncertainty_bound(self) -> float:
125        """Get current uncertainty bound estimate."""
126        return self.eta_hat
127
128    def get_confidence_interval(self, confidence: float = 0.95) -> tuple[float, float]:
129        """
130        Get confidence interval for uncertainty estimate.
131
132        Args:
133            confidence: Confidence level (0, 1)
134
135        Returns:
136            (lower_bound, upper_bound) for uncertainty estimate
137        """
138        if len(self._uncertainty_estimates) < 2:
139            margin = 0.1 * self.eta_hat
140            return (self.eta_hat - margin, self.eta_hat + margin)
141
142        estimates = np.array(self._uncertainty_estimates)
143        std_dev = np.std(estimates)
144
145        # Simple confidence interval (assuming normal distribution)
146        from scipy.stats import norm
147        z_score = norm.ppf((1 + confidence) / 2)
148        margin = z_score * std_dev
149
150        return (self.eta_hat - margin, self.eta_hat + margin)
151
152    def analyze_estimation_quality(self) -> dict:
153        """Analyze quality of uncertainty estimation."""
154        if len(self._uncertainty_estimates) < 10:
155            return {'error': 'Insufficient data for analysis'}
156
157        estimates = np.array(self._uncertainty_estimates)
158
159        return {
160            'estimate_statistics': {
161                'current_estimate': float(self.eta_hat),
162                'mean_estimate': float(np.mean(estimates)),
163                'std_estimate': float(np.std(estimates)),
164                'min_estimate': float(np.min(estimates)),
165                'max_estimate': float(np.max(estimates))
166            },
167            'convergence_metrics': {
168                'estimate_trend': float(np.polyfit(range(len(estimates)), estimates, 1)[0]),
169                'recent_variance': float(np.var(estimates[-min(20, len(estimates)):])),
170                'stability_indicator': float(np.std(estimates[-10:]) / (np.mean(estimates[-10:]) + 1e-6))
171            },
172            'estimation_health': {
173                'data_availability': len(estimates) / self.window_size,
174                'estimate_bounds_reasonable': 0.1 <= self.eta_hat <= 100.0,
175                'convergence_detected': np.std(estimates[-10:]) < 0.1 * np.mean(estimates[-10:])
176            }
177        }
178
179    # Methods for test compatibility (Control Systems Specialist interface fixes)
180    def update_estimates(self, surface_value: float, adaptation_rate: float, dt: float) -> float:
181        """
182        Compatibility method for tests - maps to update_estimate with surface derivative.
183
184        Args:
185            surface_value: Current sliding surface value
186            adaptation_rate: Adaptation rate (used as surface derivative approximation)
187            dt: Time step
188
189        Returns:
190            Updated uncertainty estimate
191        """
192        # Approximate surface derivative from adaptation rate
193        surface_derivative = adaptation_rate * surface_value
194        control_input = 0.0  # Assume no control input available in this interface
195        return self.update_estimate(surface_value, surface_derivative, control_input, dt)
196
197    @property
198    def current_estimates(self) -> np.ndarray:
199        """
200        Current uncertainty estimates for test compatibility.
201
202        Returns:
203            Array containing current estimate and recent history
204        """
205        if len(self._uncertainty_estimates) == 0:
206            return np.array([self.eta_hat])
207
208        # Return recent estimates as array
209        recent_estimates = list(self._uncertainty_estimates)[-5:]  # Last 5 estimates
210        if len(recent_estimates) == 0:
211            recent_estimates = [self.eta_hat]
212
213        return np.array(recent_estimates)
214
215
216class ParameterIdentifier:
217    """
218    Online parameter identification using recursive least squares.
219
220    Identifies unknown system parameters to improve model accuracy
221    and reduce uncertainty bounds.
222    """
223
224    def __init__(self, n_parameters: int, forgetting_factor: float = 0.98,
225                 initial_covariance: float = 100.0):
226        """
227        Initialize parameter identifier.
228
229        Args:
230            n_parameters: Number of parameters to identify
231            forgetting_factor: RLS forgetting factor Î» âˆˆ (0,1]
232            initial_covariance: Initial covariance matrix scaling
233        """
234        if n_parameters <= 0:
235            raise ValueError("Number of parameters must be positive")
236        if not (0 < forgetting_factor <= 1):
237            raise ValueError("Forgetting factor must be in (0, 1]")
238
239        self.n_params = n_parameters
240        self.lambda_rls = forgetting_factor
241
242        # RLS state
243        self.theta_hat = np.zeros(n_parameters)  # Parameter estimates
244        self.P = initial_covariance * np.eye(n_parameters)  # Covariance matrix
245
246        # History
247        self._parameter_history = []
248
249    def update_parameters(self, regressor: np.ndarray, measurement: float) -> np.ndarray:
250        """
251        Update parameter estimates using RLS algorithm.
252
253        RLS equations:
254        K(k) = P(k-1)Ï†(k) / [Î» + Ï†(k)áµ€P(k-1)Ï†(k)]
255        Î¸Ì‚(k) = Î¸Ì‚(k-1) + K(k)[y(k) - Ï†(k)áµ€Î¸Ì‚(k-1)]
256        P(k) = [P(k-1) - K(k)Ï†(k)áµ€P(k-1)] / Î»
257
258        Args:
259            regressor: Ï†(k) regressor vector
260            measurement: y(k) measurement
261
262        Returns:
263            Updated parameter estimates Î¸Ì‚(k)
264        """
265        if len(regressor) != self.n_params:
266            raise ValueError(f"Regressor size {len(regressor)} != n_parameters {self.n_params}")
267
268        phi = np.asarray(regressor).reshape(-1, 1)
269        y = float(measurement)
270
271        # RLS gain vector
272        numerator = self.P @ phi
273        denominator = self.lambda_rls + phi.T @ self.P @ phi
274        K = numerator / (denominator + 1e-10)  # Small regularization
275
276        # Prediction error
277        y_pred = phi.T @ self.theta_hat
278        error = y - y_pred
279
280        # Parameter update
281        self.theta_hat = self.theta_hat + (K * error).flatten()
282
283        # Covariance update
284        self.P = (self.P - K @ phi.T @ self.P) / self.lambda_rls
285
286        # Store history
287        self._parameter_history.append({
288            'step': len(self._parameter_history),
289            'parameters': self.theta_hat.copy(),
290            'prediction_error': float(error),
291            'gain_norm': float(np.linalg.norm(K)),
292            'covariance_trace': float(np.trace(self.P))
293        })
294
295        return self.theta_hat.copy()
296
297    def get_parameter_estimates(self) -> np.ndarray:
298        """Get current parameter estimates."""
299        return self.theta_hat.copy()
300
301    def get_parameter_covariance(self) -> np.ndarray:
302        """Get parameter covariance matrix."""
303        return self.P.copy()
304
305    def get_parameter_confidence(self, confidence: float = 0.95) -> np.ndarray:
306        """
307        Get confidence intervals for parameters.
308
309        Args:
310            confidence: Confidence level
311
312        Returns:
313            Array of (lower, upper) bounds for each parameter
314        """
315        from scipy.stats import norm
316        z_score = norm.ppf((1 + confidence) / 2)
317
318        std_devs = np.sqrt(np.diag(self.P))
319        margins = z_score * std_devs
320
321        lower_bounds = self.theta_hat - margins
322        upper_bounds = self.theta_hat + margins
323
324        return np.column_stack([lower_bounds, upper_bounds])
325
326    def reset_identifier(self, initial_covariance: float = 100.0) -> None:
327        """Reset parameter identifier state."""
328        self.theta_hat = np.zeros(self.n_params)
329        self.P = initial_covariance * np.eye(self.n_params)
330        self._parameter_history.clear()
331
332
333class CombinedEstimator:
334    """
335    Combined uncertainty estimation and parameter identification.
336
337    Integrates uncertainty estimation with parameter identification
338    for improved adaptive SMC performance.
339    """
340
341    def __init__(self, n_parameters: int = 4, **kwargs):
342        """
343        Initialize combined estimator.
344
345        Args:
346            n_parameters: Number of system parameters to identify
347            **kwargs: Parameters for sub-estimators
348        """
349        self.uncertainty_estimator = UncertaintyEstimator(**kwargs)
350        self.parameter_identifier = ParameterIdentifier(n_parameters, **kwargs)
351
352        self._estimation_active = True
353
354    def update_estimates(self, surface_value: float, surface_derivative: float,
355                        control_input: float, regressor: np.ndarray,
356                        measurement: float, dt: float) -> dict:
357        """
358        Update both uncertainty and parameter estimates.
359
360        Args:
361            surface_value: Sliding surface value
362            surface_derivative: Surface derivative
363            control_input: Applied control
364            regressor: Parameter identification regressor
365            measurement: Parameter identification measurement
366            dt: Time step
367
368        Returns:
369            Combined estimation results
370        """
371        results = {}
372
373        if self._estimation_active:
374            # Update uncertainty estimate
375            uncertainty_bound = self.uncertainty_estimator.update_estimate(
376                surface_value, surface_derivative, control_input, dt
377            )
378
379            # Update parameter estimates
380            parameters = self.parameter_identifier.update_parameters(regressor, measurement)
381
382            results = {
383                'uncertainty_bound': uncertainty_bound,
384                'parameters': parameters,
385                'parameter_covariance': self.parameter_identifier.get_parameter_covariance(),
386                'estimation_active': True
387            }
388        else:
389            results = {
390                'uncertainty_bound': self.uncertainty_estimator.get_uncertainty_bound(),
391                'parameters': self.parameter_identifier.get_parameter_estimates(),
392                'estimation_active': False
393            }
394
395        return results
396
397    def set_estimation_active(self, active: bool) -> None:
398        """Enable/disable online estimation."""
399        self._estimation_active = active
400
401    def get_combined_analysis(self) -> dict:
402        """Get comprehensive analysis of estimation performance."""
403        uncertainty_analysis = self.uncertainty_estimator.analyze_estimation_quality()
404
405        return {
406            'uncertainty_analysis': uncertainty_analysis,
407            'parameter_estimates': self.parameter_identifier.get_parameter_estimates(),
408            'parameter_confidence': self.parameter_identifier.get_parameter_confidence(),
409            'estimation_status': {
410                'active': self._estimation_active,
411                'parameter_history_length': len(self.parameter_identifier._parameter_history),
412                'uncertainty_history_length': len(self.uncertainty_estimator._uncertainty_estimates)
413            }
414        }

ClassesÂ¶

UncertaintyEstimatorÂ¶

Online uncertainty estimation for adaptive SMC.

Estimates bounds on system uncertainties and disturbances to improve adaptive gain selection.

Source CodeÂ¶

  1class UncertaintyEstimator:
  2    """
  3    Online uncertainty estimation for adaptive SMC.
  4
  5    Estimates bounds on system uncertainties and disturbances
  6    to improve adaptive gain selection.
  7    """
  8
  9    def __init__(self,
 10                 window_size: int = 50,
 11                 forgetting_factor: float = 0.95,
 12                 initial_estimate: float = 1.0,
 13                 estimation_gain: float = 0.1):
 14        """
 15        Initialize uncertainty estimator.
 16
 17        Args:
 18            window_size: Size of sliding window for estimation
 19            forgetting_factor: Î» âˆˆ (0,1] for exponential forgetting
 20            initial_estimate: Initial uncertainty bound estimate
 21            estimation_gain: Learning rate for uncertainty adaptation
 22        """
 23        if not (0 < forgetting_factor <= 1):
 24            raise ValueError("Forgetting factor must be in (0, 1]")
 25        if window_size <= 0:
 26            raise ValueError("Window size must be positive")
 27        if initial_estimate <= 0:
 28            raise ValueError("Initial estimate must be positive")
 29        if estimation_gain <= 0:
 30            raise ValueError("Estimation gain must be positive")
 31
 32        self.window_size = window_size
 33        self.lambda_forget = forgetting_factor
 34        self.eta_hat = initial_estimate
 35        self.alpha = estimation_gain
 36
 37        # History buffers
 38        self._surface_history = deque(maxlen=window_size)
 39        self._control_history = deque(maxlen=window_size)
 40        self._surface_derivative_history = deque(maxlen=window_size)
 41        self._uncertainty_estimates = deque(maxlen=window_size)
 42
 43    def update_estimate(self, surface_value: float, surface_derivative: float,
 44                       control_input: float, dt: float) -> float:
 45        """
 46        Update uncertainty estimate based on sliding surface behavior.
 47
 48        Args:
 49            surface_value: Current sliding surface s
 50            surface_derivative: Surface derivative á¹¡
 51            control_input: Applied control u
 52            dt: Time step
 53
 54        Returns:
 55            Updated uncertainty bound estimate Î·Ì‚
 56        """
 57        # Store history
 58        self._surface_history.append(surface_value)
 59        self._surface_derivative_history.append(surface_derivative)
 60        self._control_history.append(control_input)
 61
 62        # Estimate uncertainty from sliding surface behavior
 63        uncertainty_indicator = self._compute_uncertainty_indicator(
 64            surface_value, surface_derivative, control_input
 65        )
 66
 67        # Update estimate with forgetting factor
 68        self.eta_hat = (self.lambda_forget * self.eta_hat +
 69                       self.alpha * uncertainty_indicator)
 70
 71        # Store estimate
 72        self._uncertainty_estimates.append(self.eta_hat)
 73
 74        return self.eta_hat
 75
 76    def _compute_uncertainty_indicator(self, s: float, s_dot: float, u: float) -> float:
 77        """
 78        Compute uncertainty indicator from surface behavior.
 79
 80        High uncertainty is indicated by:
 81        - Large |á¹¡| despite control effort
 82        - Persistent surface magnitude |s|
 83        - High control effort with poor surface reduction
 84        """
 85        # Method 1: Surface derivative magnitude (indicates reaching law violation)
 86        reaching_violation = abs(s_dot) + abs(s)  # Should be negative for reaching
 87
 88        # Method 2: Control effectiveness (high u with large |s| indicates uncertainty)
 89        if abs(u) > 1e-6:
 90            control_effectiveness = abs(s) / (abs(u) + 1e-6)
 91        else:
 92            control_effectiveness = abs(s)
 93
 94        # Method 3: Sliding condition violation
 95        sliding_condition = s * s_dot  # Should be negative for sliding
 96
 97        # Combine indicators
 98        uncertainty_indicator = (0.4 * reaching_violation +
 99                               0.4 * control_effectiveness +
100                               0.2 * max(0, sliding_condition))
101
102        return uncertainty_indicator
103
104    def get_uncertainty_bound(self) -> float:
105        """Get current uncertainty bound estimate."""
106        return self.eta_hat
107
108    def get_confidence_interval(self, confidence: float = 0.95) -> tuple[float, float]:
109        """
110        Get confidence interval for uncertainty estimate.
111
112        Args:
113            confidence: Confidence level (0, 1)
114
115        Returns:
116            (lower_bound, upper_bound) for uncertainty estimate
117        """
118        if len(self._uncertainty_estimates) < 2:
119            margin = 0.1 * self.eta_hat
120            return (self.eta_hat - margin, self.eta_hat + margin)
121
122        estimates = np.array(self._uncertainty_estimates)
123        std_dev = np.std(estimates)
124
125        # Simple confidence interval (assuming normal distribution)
126        from scipy.stats import norm
127        z_score = norm.ppf((1 + confidence) / 2)
128        margin = z_score * std_dev
129
130        return (self.eta_hat - margin, self.eta_hat + margin)
131
132    def analyze_estimation_quality(self) -> dict:
133        """Analyze quality of uncertainty estimation."""
134        if len(self._uncertainty_estimates) < 10:
135            return {'error': 'Insufficient data for analysis'}
136
137        estimates = np.array(self._uncertainty_estimates)
138
139        return {
140            'estimate_statistics': {
141                'current_estimate': float(self.eta_hat),
142                'mean_estimate': float(np.mean(estimates)),
143                'std_estimate': float(np.std(estimates)),
144                'min_estimate': float(np.min(estimates)),
145                'max_estimate': float(np.max(estimates))
146            },
147            'convergence_metrics': {
148                'estimate_trend': float(np.polyfit(range(len(estimates)), estimates, 1)[0]),
149                'recent_variance': float(np.var(estimates[-min(20, len(estimates)):])),
150                'stability_indicator': float(np.std(estimates[-10:]) / (np.mean(estimates[-10:]) + 1e-6))
151            },
152            'estimation_health': {
153                'data_availability': len(estimates) / self.window_size,
154                'estimate_bounds_reasonable': 0.1 <= self.eta_hat <= 100.0,
155                'convergence_detected': np.std(estimates[-10:]) < 0.1 * np.mean(estimates[-10:])
156            }
157        }
158
159    # Methods for test compatibility (Control Systems Specialist interface fixes)
160    def update_estimates(self, surface_value: float, adaptation_rate: float, dt: float) -> float:
161        """
162        Compatibility method for tests - maps to update_estimate with surface derivative.
163
164        Args:
165            surface_value: Current sliding surface value
166            adaptation_rate: Adaptation rate (used as surface derivative approximation)
167            dt: Time step
168
169        Returns:
170            Updated uncertainty estimate
171        """
172        # Approximate surface derivative from adaptation rate
173        surface_derivative = adaptation_rate * surface_value
174        control_input = 0.0  # Assume no control input available in this interface
175        return self.update_estimate(surface_value, surface_derivative, control_input, dt)
176
177    @property
178    def current_estimates(self) -> np.ndarray:
179        """
180        Current uncertainty estimates for test compatibility.
181
182        Returns:
183            Array containing current estimate and recent history
184        """
185        if len(self._uncertainty_estimates) == 0:
186            return np.array([self.eta_hat])
187
188        # Return recent estimates as array
189        recent_estimates = list(self._uncertainty_estimates)[-5:]  # Last 5 estimates
190        if len(recent_estimates) == 0:
191            recent_estimates = [self.eta_hat]
192
193        return np.array(recent_estimates)

ParameterIdentifierÂ¶

Online parameter identification using recursive least squares.

Identifies unknown system parameters to improve model accuracy and reduce uncertainty bounds.

Source CodeÂ¶

  1class ParameterIdentifier:
  2    """
  3    Online parameter identification using recursive least squares.
  4
  5    Identifies unknown system parameters to improve model accuracy
  6    and reduce uncertainty bounds.
  7    """
  8
  9    def __init__(self, n_parameters: int, forgetting_factor: float = 0.98,
 10                 initial_covariance: float = 100.0):
 11        """
 12        Initialize parameter identifier.
 13
 14        Args:
 15            n_parameters: Number of parameters to identify
 16            forgetting_factor: RLS forgetting factor Î» âˆˆ (0,1]
 17            initial_covariance: Initial covariance matrix scaling
 18        """
 19        if n_parameters <= 0:
 20            raise ValueError("Number of parameters must be positive")
 21        if not (0 < forgetting_factor <= 1):
 22            raise ValueError("Forgetting factor must be in (0, 1]")
 23
 24        self.n_params = n_parameters
 25        self.lambda_rls = forgetting_factor
 26
 27        # RLS state
 28        self.theta_hat = np.zeros(n_parameters)  # Parameter estimates
 29        self.P = initial_covariance * np.eye(n_parameters)  # Covariance matrix
 30
 31        # History
 32        self._parameter_history = []
 33
 34    def update_parameters(self, regressor: np.ndarray, measurement: float) -> np.ndarray:
 35        """
 36        Update parameter estimates using RLS algorithm.
 37
 38        RLS equations:
 39        K(k) = P(k-1)Ï†(k) / [Î» + Ï†(k)áµ€P(k-1)Ï†(k)]
 40        Î¸Ì‚(k) = Î¸Ì‚(k-1) + K(k)[y(k) - Ï†(k)áµ€Î¸Ì‚(k-1)]
 41        P(k) = [P(k-1) - K(k)Ï†(k)áµ€P(k-1)] / Î»
 42
 43        Args:
 44            regressor: Ï†(k) regressor vector
 45            measurement: y(k) measurement
 46
 47        Returns:
 48            Updated parameter estimates Î¸Ì‚(k)
 49        """
 50        if len(regressor) != self.n_params:
 51            raise ValueError(f"Regressor size {len(regressor)} != n_parameters {self.n_params}")
 52
 53        phi = np.asarray(regressor).reshape(-1, 1)
 54        y = float(measurement)
 55
 56        # RLS gain vector
 57        numerator = self.P @ phi
 58        denominator = self.lambda_rls + phi.T @ self.P @ phi
 59        K = numerator / (denominator + 1e-10)  # Small regularization
 60
 61        # Prediction error
 62        y_pred = phi.T @ self.theta_hat
 63        error = y - y_pred
 64
 65        # Parameter update
 66        self.theta_hat = self.theta_hat + (K * error).flatten()
 67
 68        # Covariance update
 69        self.P = (self.P - K @ phi.T @ self.P) / self.lambda_rls
 70
 71        # Store history
 72        self._parameter_history.append({
 73            'step': len(self._parameter_history),
 74            'parameters': self.theta_hat.copy(),
 75            'prediction_error': float(error),
 76            'gain_norm': float(np.linalg.norm(K)),
 77            'covariance_trace': float(np.trace(self.P))
 78        })
 79
 80        return self.theta_hat.copy()
 81
 82    def get_parameter_estimates(self) -> np.ndarray:
 83        """Get current parameter estimates."""
 84        return self.theta_hat.copy()
 85
 86    def get_parameter_covariance(self) -> np.ndarray:
 87        """Get parameter covariance matrix."""
 88        return self.P.copy()
 89
 90    def get_parameter_confidence(self, confidence: float = 0.95) -> np.ndarray:
 91        """
 92        Get confidence intervals for parameters.
 93
 94        Args:
 95            confidence: Confidence level
 96
 97        Returns:
 98            Array of (lower, upper) bounds for each parameter
 99        """
100        from scipy.stats import norm
101        z_score = norm.ppf((1 + confidence) / 2)
102
103        std_devs = np.sqrt(np.diag(self.P))
104        margins = z_score * std_devs
105
106        lower_bounds = self.theta_hat - margins
107        upper_bounds = self.theta_hat + margins
108
109        return np.column_stack([lower_bounds, upper_bounds])
110
111    def reset_identifier(self, initial_covariance: float = 100.0) -> None:
112        """Reset parameter identifier state."""
113        self.theta_hat = np.zeros(self.n_params)
114        self.P = initial_covariance * np.eye(self.n_params)
115        self._parameter_history.clear()

CombinedEstimatorÂ¶

Combined uncertainty estimation and parameter identification.

Source CodeÂ¶

 1class CombinedEstimator:
 2    """
 3    Combined uncertainty estimation and parameter identification.
 4
 5    Integrates uncertainty estimation with parameter identification
 6    for improved adaptive SMC performance.
 7    """
 8
 9    def __init__(self, n_parameters: int = 4, **kwargs):
10        """
11        Initialize combined estimator.
12
13        Args:
14            n_parameters: Number of system parameters to identify
15            **kwargs: Parameters for sub-estimators
16        """
17        self.uncertainty_estimator = UncertaintyEstimator(**kwargs)
18        self.parameter_identifier = ParameterIdentifier(n_parameters, **kwargs)
19
20        self._estimation_active = True
21
22    def update_estimates(self, surface_value: float, surface_derivative: float,
23                        control_input: float, regressor: np.ndarray,
24                        measurement: float, dt: float) -> dict:
25        """
26        Update both uncertainty and parameter estimates.
27
28        Args:
29            surface_value: Sliding surface value
30            surface_derivative: Surface derivative
31            control_input: Applied control
32            regressor: Parameter identification regressor
33            measurement: Parameter identification measurement
34            dt: Time step
35
36        Returns:
37            Combined estimation results
38        """
39        results = {}
40
41        if self._estimation_active:
42            # Update uncertainty estimate
43            uncertainty_bound = self.uncertainty_estimator.update_estimate(
44                surface_value, surface_derivative, control_input, dt
45            )
46
47            # Update parameter estimates
48            parameters = self.parameter_identifier.update_parameters(regressor, measurement)
49
50            results = {
51                'uncertainty_bound': uncertainty_bound,
52                'parameters': parameters,
53                'parameter_covariance': self.parameter_identifier.get_parameter_covariance(),
54                'estimation_active': True
55            }
56        else:
57            results = {
58                'uncertainty_bound': self.uncertainty_estimator.get_uncertainty_bound(),
59                'parameters': self.parameter_identifier.get_parameter_estimates(),
60                'estimation_active': False
61            }
62
63        return results
64
65    def set_estimation_active(self, active: bool) -> None:
66        """Enable/disable online estimation."""
67        self._estimation_active = active
68
69    def get_combined_analysis(self) -> dict:
70        """Get comprehensive analysis of estimation performance."""
71        uncertainty_analysis = self.uncertainty_estimator.analyze_estimation_quality()
72
73        return {
74            'uncertainty_analysis': uncertainty_analysis,
75            'parameter_estimates': self.parameter_identifier.get_parameter_estimates(),
76            'parameter_confidence': self.parameter_identifier.get_parameter_confidence(),
77            'estimation_status': {
78                'active': self._estimation_active,
79                'parameter_history_length': len(self.parameter_identifier._parameter_history),
80                'uncertainty_history_length': len(self.uncertainty_estimator._uncertainty_estimates)
81            }
82        }
